website_summaries.verdict: LEGO lovers will enjoy using this kit to create simple machines. Keep in mind you will need many more bricks than come with this set.
pros: Children use items from this kit and other LEGO components to build 10 simple machines
Gives detailed directions for building slides, chutes, and more
cons: You will need to own or buy a healthy supply of LEGO pieces to use with this kit
Best for upper end of age range

website_summaries.verdict: More than just a toy, it's a fun way to get kids age 8 and up interested in basic technology concepts that inspire imagination – just be prepared to purchase more LEGO pieces.
pros: An award-winner based on STEM concepts designed by scientists to inspire kids to explore how building pieces work together
Comes with more than 30 LEGO components and an instructional guide to get them started
cons: While it has a lot to offer, it also requires additional LEGO pieced to complete many of the projects listed in the guide

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Not sure who is having more fun, my husband or the kids (5 and 7 years.) They love engineering, building, projects, etc. If you are like-minded this shouldn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: The next level of Legos!
customer_reviews.text: If your child loves Legos, but has completed countless sets of them and you want to quit spending $50+ per set, this is for you! My 8-year-old child found this to be way more challenging than a Lego set and played with it for much longer. It includes several projects that build on each other to form a chain reaction. It does require some basic pieces, but most Legos enthusiasts would have them or you can buy a basic set of random pieces, I think. Highly recommend this product and we will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: E Family E

customer_reviews.title: Students found this boring!
customer_reviews.text: I love brining in new STEAM activities for my students to explore and create during down time. This was by far the least favorite, only one (of ten) student was temporarily engaged, but that was short lived. Wish I could get my money back to buy something that they will actually use and learn from.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: but this book was an utter disappointment. The lego balls provided are too big to ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids are into legos and have other books thst rock, but this book was an utter disappointment. The lego balls provided are too big to fit it lego machines made on YouTube, and the contraptions in the book are not sturdy, or very cool. Book ended up in the trash along with all the flimsy cardboard the book provides for the contraptions.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: The bar code the instructions tell you to use to see the operations of each item you build directs you to a web site to buy more items and not show the item working. Very misleading and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Carnes

customer_reviews.title: Too bad the photo really sold me
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift and returned since most of what is shown is paper and cardboard nothing that would last no matter what age it was for. Too bad the photo really sold me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rause

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to Lego
customer_reviews.text: My son loves all things Lego. These Klutz sets are a great addition, as you can see we love them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy B.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy! My only issue is that the cardboard ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy! My only issue is that the cardboard cutouts that form the various funnels and slides get softer with time and eventually wear out. My son played the heck out of this, but after two weeks couldn't play with it anymore because the cardboard had started to get flimsy. My advice? Save your money and buy something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: AYB

customer_reviews.title: Good, but limited in scope
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this book, and ultimately I think my nephew will like it, but it's not quite what I was expecting. It's basically instructions on how to build a marble run with Lego. Kind of confusing, definitely for older kids, and in my opinion, kind of boring, but I'm not a Lego buff. I am still going to give it to my nephew as a gift, but I had hoped it would be a little more exciting with more design options, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Bought because of positive experiences with Klutz, but disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was going to be a really enhancement to my nephew's Lego kit, but it was extremely underwhelming. I thought this was going to teach engineering/creativity, but the book and parts included fall well short of my expectations of encouraging STEM. My nephew (in 6th grade) got bored of it really quickly, as did I. A lot of potential for a great product/concept, but it seems they cut every corner.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with it at all
customer_reviews.text: This was missing a lot of pieces. My son played with it once and then we figured out why he couldn’t do any of the suggested builds.
customer_reviews.author: Frenkel

customer_reviews.title: Creative toy
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure after the reviews but got it for my 4 1/2 year old Lego loving son for Christmas. We have a lot of Legos in the house so it sounded like we'd be fine on building along with this. Is it ever! After building one chain reaction with him, he has built and rebuilt every chain reaction and shows off his cool "mommy come see my new chain reaction, I used new colors and it still works!" Creating a budding engineer. We all love it. Would be great for age 4-8.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bienz

customer_reviews.title: Zip! Zing! Zoom!
customer_reviews.text: I had a ton of fun digging through my bricks and trying to build as many of the things that I can. There is a plastic sleeve, which closes, at the back of the book to hold your paper items safely. The only thing I didn't like was that you had to take apart the book to get the paper items out. Thankfully it wasn't too hard to do nor did it take that much time. The paper is thick enough to last a bit but you could also easily trace them out on other paper if needed. Overall a great Lego/Klutz book to add to your collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what we have expected from picture ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what we are getting into when purchasing this toy. It requires a lot more accessories or pieces in order to make anything / lego toys. Now, it is languishing in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: This is great for little Lego lovers
customer_reviews.text: This is great for little Lego lovers! My son was really frustrated with the rubberbands not being useable and breaking anytime he tried, but overall I recommend this for ages 8 and up.
customer_reviews.author: nobody

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bonding activity
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the LEGO Reaction kit as a present for my 4 year old. My husband and son spend hours experimenting on different projects. Perfect bonding activity. Easy to use, directions are well written.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: This is a HOW TO
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this for my 7 year old who loves STEM and science and all things to do with kinetics too. Here is my issue, perhaps I did not read but this is simply a book. It does not come with any legos to do the actual chain reactions so make sure you either already have the required legos on hand or purchase them at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Cool projects, not enough pieces
customer_reviews.text: This kit definitely assumes you already have a ton of legos. We have some legos, not a whole lot, but we were able to make most of the projects work. Unfortunately, several of the projects also have paper/cardboard pieces and other flimsy elements that don't work too well. It's a nice idea, but seriously lacking in raw materials. It would have been better to simply sell it as a project instruction book and leave the parts purchase to the individual. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Mac

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas present for my 7 year old nephew. He loves Legos and constructing when he is in the rare creative mood. I wanted to get his focus off of video games and wanted to try to get him into buidling something. He and his step father have created a few of the things from the book and from what I hear, he had a pretty fun time with the interaction. I saw one of them on Duo, he was so excited he wanted to call me and have me watch. He was most impressed that he did it himself.
customer_reviews.author: ImThatDingo

customer_reviews.title: Learning while building legos
customer_reviews.text: Klutz Lego Chain Reactions Science & Building Kit is a good starter kit but for kids younger than 7 or ones that tend to get easily frustrated will not like this. If the child loves to build and follow instructions and have a adult help them in need, this is a good set. The joy that comes from building it and having it work as expected is wonderful. It will teach the kids to be patient and concentrate unlike normal lego blocks. Good gift for kids older than 8.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Irfan

customer_reviews.title: It's a very cool set and my 5
customer_reviews.text: It's a very cool set and my 5.5 son loves it (i need to help him to set everything up). When I bought this set, I didn't realize how much more of Lego do you need! We just have a starter Lego box and it's definitely not enough. We haven't tried all the machines, but it looks like with the special blocks included you can't build all of them at the same time. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Need addition basic Lego to do the projects
customer_reviews.text: Be warned- not all the pieces needed to do the projects are included with the set. Every project needs a number of basic Lego blocks to build structures that are not in the kit. This makes for some disappointment when opened away from home and away from other Legos. The projects look like fun but it is Christmas Day and he cannot really play with them until he gets home in a few days. His brother got a similar kit from the same company "Contraptions" that came with everything he needs so the disappointment is heightened.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Great book for Grandson who has lots of Legos
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for our grandson. He has many Legos and his parents do not like us to just buy him more. This book allowed him to use what he already has in a different way. He was able to make something right away even without all his Legos which were at home. I know he will enjoy all the chain reactions he will be able to create. And we may purchase more Klutz books in the future.
customer_reviews.author: sevh

customer_reviews.title: You need a lego collection to use this book
customer_reviews.text: Wth Klutz I love klutz books they are always great , this particular book is so frustrating where exactly does it say you need a lego collection to actually get use out of this book or to be able to do the projects, how stupid is that! I purchased this for my son since he is home in the shelter in place and he can’t even do the stuff , ffs !
customer_reviews.author: Green Bean

customer_reviews.title: Good challenge for a kid!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift to challenge a kid to think beyond Lego's. The child had a hard time with the instructions because he had never added string and other things. Super gift to make them think outside of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Requires your own mega collection of assorted bricks and planks
customer_reviews.text: Even with a bunch of our own Lego sets and collections, we could not build half of the contraptions in this product! This product only comes with a few selected pieces, you need your own supply to build almost every project. They should supply more specific pieces for these projects, you know how hard it is to find a 1x2 plank or 1x2 slant?! If you have a product that allows kids to build these projects, INCLUDE ALL THE NECESSARY PIECES!
customer_reviews.author: Li Li

customer_reviews.title: Great for a curious four year old
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my four year old to build together with me or my husband. He loves Lego and he loves learning about how things work so I figured this might be a great way to teach him. It is a bit difficult for him to do by himself but it's a perfect project to bond over. There's a bunch of different projects to do and they're all very fun. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kaalijaae

customer_reviews.title: Good but not enough pieces
customer_reviews.text: My son enjoyed creating the chain reaction with this set. But the pieces are only enough to create one chain reaction. I had to buy another Lego set worth $40 with 900 pieces to be able for him to try other chain reactions in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Garima Anand

customer_reviews.title: A bit thin, but a good project
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have said, there isn't much "there" there. Some neat ideas and projects, but you do need a lot of other Legos to make it work. Would be better at a few bucks less, but if you know what you're getting into it's a good project for the Lego-addicted.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: The Kid Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: *Before I start my review I must say you will have to have some legos already to do some of the builds in this book.* With that being said... My kid loves this book. We’ve made two builds so far. It kept my 6yo’s attention the entire time and being able to use the legos already in the house was exciting. Easy and awesome way to teach your kid physics. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda V.

customer_reviews.title: fun to assemble
customer_reviews.text: it was difficult lining everything up to get the chain reaction to work. Maybe the instructions weren't clear - but I had to jury rig a part or two to get them to line up for the ball to hit into all the moving arms and ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Plumhunter

customer_reviews.title: Not as cool as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I got this for my son for Christmas. It's a little more difficult to folow a long to make the contraptions. It has some parts but you have to dig through your own legos for lots of pieces. The chain reactions just weren't as cool as I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Slmh

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Hardly any actual pieces. This is basically a book with paper cut outs to use to create flimsy contraptions. I returned it right way.
customer_reviews.author: Carol from Federalsburg, MD

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughters enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: They built something right away. Seem to enjoy it a lot. Ages 4, 6, 9, and 11
customer_reviews.author: PEDAGOGUE

customer_reviews.title: Well written and fun even for little kids
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son saw this in a store and asked for it for Christmas. It’s a little advanced for his age but I obliged because he really wanted it so we could help him build the cool structures inside the book. He doesn’t appreciate the explanations of why they experiments work at his age but he was able to follow the instructions mostly by himself with some help from me. Overall a good book that gets them using their minds.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Very cool book. Does rely on you having a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the instructions use pieces that are specialty. Very cool book. Does rely on you having a good lego collection so maybe not for someone starting out. We have a zillion legos and this is fun for the kids to renew a passion for legos and also learn about different machines
customer_reviews.author: stephanie toth

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Educational!
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened this package my reaction was, "Hmmmm.... Is that all?" But it has kept my 6yo busy for days (just finished the third "machine") and is really helping him to think for himself about the sizes and shapes of the blocks, what is a suitable replacement, organizing his spare pieces a bit more, and is otherwise more challenging than a kit where everything is prearranged.
customer_reviews.author: LaniO

customer_reviews.title: Binded improperly
customer_reviews.text: The book I ordered for my son was assembled weird. The first 24 pages were great. After that they were upside down and backwards. So we’re 25 should be was 78 upside down. Rather odd. I’ve wrapped it for Christmas and may return it if we can’t rebind it properly or if he is okay with it. I think he’ll love it, so I’m excited to see what he thinks!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Fun to explore
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 9 yo daughter and when we work with this we both have a great time exploring the differently triggers and reactions. She really seems to light up when we get going with these projects! The hardest part is finding legos that aren't part of an existing build to use in addition to the ones provided. Might need to get more legos!
customer_reviews.author: D. Mize

customer_reviews.title: Great for tinkering, learning, STEM, and fun
customer_reviews.text: So far my 6 yo and I built the first contraption. It did not need any additional Lego pieces (but other contraptions in the book do need extra legos from your own collection). It was a success and it was so fun for us to tinker together on it. We did have a little hiccup as the instructions are not step by step. This would make a perfect gift!
customer_reviews.author: kwb

customer_reviews.title: Fun For 6 Year Old
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my 6 year old grandson who is not a huge Lego fan (he prefers cars) but has access to a huge assortment of Legos courtesy of an older brother and the collections of his father and uncle. He enjoyed paging through the book and has built several of the machines without help. I am very pleased with the ideas presented and appreciate that it teaches mechanical thinking. Buyers do need to be aware that extra Legos will be needed when building.
customer_reviews.author: PWCSTech

customer_reviews.title: We don’t have enough regular pieces.
customer_reviews.text: While this book has some great ideas and fairly clear step by step instructions, we are about 1/3 way through and finding that we don’t have enough of the standard pieces from our own collection to make any more machines. It’s funny to think that in our 18 gallon Rubbermaid tote, we only have 4 of the 2x8 that are required. We have more special and angular bricks than standard 2x4 bricks. While you can substitute some bricks for others, some you just can’t.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for a 4 year old boy
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this is great, but it should be for someone who really likes to do things with his/her hands, not someone with a short attention span. It takes quite a bit of care to make the chain reactions work properly. My 5 year old just wasn't that in to it. There are quite a few pieces that are easy to loose which would mean that you might not be able to make some of the projects if they were lost.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne M.

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: I feel this is a little overpriced @ $22 for the amount of pieces. There are pieces of cardboard that counts. you do not get many legos. To me you are paying for the instructions. While it does create some cool stuff and my son did not like it at first. Then he added on using his imagination and I think this helped him get ideas on what he can do on his other legos.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but poor execution
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my son. He loves “contraptions” and I knew he’d love building these obstacles. The idea book is great, but you need to realize that this kit does NOT contain all the Legos you need. It says you need to “use Legos from your collection.” This has been very frustrating to my son, as he is a new LEGO collector and doesn’t have a ton of pieces. We were very disappointing in this design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Emily in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT come with LEGOS!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great intro to LEGO machines for my niece. I have taught LEGO classes and used the earlier "Crazy Action Contraptions" and thought this was a "second version.." This does not come with LEGO bricks. You have to supply your own. That was not made clear in the ad. Unfortunately it is Christmas Eve, and I cannot go buy a batch of LEGO bricks to go with this useless product. :(
customer_reviews.author: missmaddie

customer_reviews.title: not enough pieces
customer_reviews.text: I did buy it as a birthday gift for my son who really likes to build things from legos. It did seem like a really nice gift until I actually opened it. Little ramps and funnel is like a paper plate material and I would say easily breakable/tearable. I though that every piece will be like original legos=plastic and sturdy. I guess I should've been looking at pictures more carefully. This is something to consider if you really buying it to last a long time. If I would know that it's gonna be like that I would never buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, but need a lot more LEGO bricks
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5-year old nephew as he loves playing LEGO. He likes the creative ideas mentioned in the book so he learns more ways to play around his LEGO bricks. Unfortunately, he is very disappointing that he was only able to complete the first project with help from adults. There are too many missing bricks for the rest of the projects mentioned in the book.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Its Lego, its Klutz, you cant go wrong
customer_reviews.text: These will keep kids busy for an hour or two. The instructions are easy to follow for kids to use without adult help. I gave it 4 stars because of the shipping. These were sent in a crushed box that was inside of a box that was not damaged, so damaged items were sent knowingly. We ended up using them anyway. The kids in our homeschool coop received these and played with them for about an hour with little help from an adult being needed. I have never been let down from a Klutz product.
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle Marie

customer_reviews.title: They like it now.
customer_reviews.text: I'm calling this gift the long game. We ordered this 2 years ago. My kids seemed interested but didn't really use as the book suggest or at all. However, over the last 2 years they have started what they call chain reactions. I think they have read the book and are now coming up with their own chain reactions. So even thought it wasn't initially a hit, it has provided inspiration for their creations today.
customer_reviews.author: teriney

customer_reviews.title: Great ides for a child with an imagination
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loved it. He's a 8 year old that will probably grow up to be a Mcgyver. Most toys only bore him but this one has kept him interested for hours.
customer_reviews.author: P. Coe

customer_reviews.title: Grandparent fail!
customer_reviews.text: Our 6yo grandson is very proficient and creative with his Lego building so we thought this would be a great addition to his sets. Unfortunately, he had difficulty using these without considerable assistance from adults and lost interest in them very quickly. Maybe we should have waited until he was a bit older. Turned out to be a $20 fail!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Beanie

customer_reviews.title: Not made very well. Difficult to put together.
customer_reviews.text: We loved the idea of this set. But it's cheaply made. All items included to help build the contraptions are made of paper that isn't quite card stock. Even the little balls are plastic so they aren't quite heavy enough to set off the contraptions. We weren't impressed and our son, who loves anything like this, was quickly discouraged and never did put more than the first two or three sets together.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie D. Snitker

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Good Value,  Well Written, Engaging for Mechanically Minded Children 8-12
customer_reviews.text: This book is Good Quality, Good Value, Well Written, Engaging for Mechanically Minded Children 8-16.. We have bought a number of these sets. Children ages 8-9 may need adult help..Ages 10-2 would be more independent with these activities.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Needs additional Lego.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson liked this kit, but I wish they had indicated on the box what additional Lego are needed to make all the contraptions. He opened it on his birthday and we were able to assemble one thing. But he did not have enough Legos to do the others. Most of his old Lego kits have specialized bricks that did not work with this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Digirolamo

customer_reviews.title: The kit is not complete.  Don't buy unless you have legos already!
customer_reviews.text: Sort of a bummer for your kid when they open it up, dump out he pieces and all of the instructions require additional legos. My kids weren't all that in to legos, so we don't have any. But I thought he'd enjoy these projects. Buyer beware... you need a lot of legos to enjoy this in addition to what is in the kit. That wasn't in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Viger

customer_reviews.title: Great for any age "kid"
customer_reviews.text: 75 year-old Gramma likes to find toys for herself and 9 year-old grand-daughter. We had a lot of fun and killed close to an hour building the first item. I liked the physics explanation on energy - can't create, can't destroy - and read it out loud. She'll read it again herself, I am sure. You have to be precise when assembling the blocks but it's so exciting when it works. We simply laughed at ourselves when we messed up.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Pirozzi

customer_reviews.title: I loved this book
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book. I purchased for my 9 year old for her birthday. She inherited a lot of her older brother's legos but has no interest in building police stations, planes, etc, or following any of the intricate instructions those sets came with. This book was right up her alley, building simpler things with the legos she already has. It sparked her imagination and shortly into it we were building whole new systems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fun experimenting
customer_reviews.text: I like this for experimenting with levers and pulleys. It mainly peaked my interest in LEGO GBC. Although the book says they are LEGO balls - they are not stamped with the LEGO logo. They are larger than the official soccer balls and basket balls. You’ll need lots of your own legos to play with this set. These pieces are mainly for anyone who doesn’t have LEGO Technic pieces and an early intro to physical mechanics.
customer_reviews.author: Lewie

customer_reviews.title: doesn't include all the specialty parts to make all machines interact!
customer_reviews.text: I understood when I bought it that the basic blocks were not included, and I was ok with that. But it's supposed to be a CHAIN reaction meaning that each contraption is supposed to trigger other contraptions. You can't do that when you only have enough parts to one of the machines at a time! The machines were individually really fun and cool, but honestly, legos don't cost that much to make, so why couldn't they supply a complete set? Goodness knows I paid enough for the kit.
customer_reviews.author: jennabenna

customer_reviews.title: Detailed Instrctions
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my son. He's been addicted to building working Lego machines since attending a summer STEM camp. Although I wish this included a small Lego set as well, I'm impressed with the detailed instructions and mechanisms included to build multiple projects!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Not as exciting as described
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I read the wrong info, but I thought this was supposed to come with everything needed to build the "chain reactions". The 30 pieces that are included are simply the more mechanical parts. You have to buy the rest of the lego blocks separately. You could buy plenty more of the mechanic pieces for the same price since here you're practically just paying for the book.
customer_reviews.author: Soneeuhz

customer_reviews.title: This is really fun. A word of caution though
customer_reviews.text: This is really fun. A word of caution though: if you are getting it for a child and they're not used to doing things by themselves then you will need to do this with them... if they're ok and used to working independently/experimenting then they can do it solo but things need to be done in a specific order, with specific parts...you can't lose anything or the chain reaction won't work. When it does though- and it may take some tweaking of the pieces- then they're super excited though!
customer_reviews.author: Nora's Mom

customer_reviews.title: He was thrilled
customer_reviews.text: Little boy 5 years old just learned to read loves Legos. He was amazed they had books to show him how to build different projects. I got the best gift kudo "Aunt you give the best things for gifts" LOL
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: A great way to extend the life of your kid's Legos.
customer_reviews.text: From my ten year old son: "It's cool because I like Legos and making chain reactions with it is really fun. It also tells you how to do it and gives you some of the basic pieces on how to build it." Warning to parents: some of the pieces are mere paper and will not last unless you laminate them or replace them with cardboard lookalikes. That's the only cheap part about this set.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Samurai

customer_reviews.title: Great Time that lasts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit for my year old son for Christmas years ago. He built some of the easy tasks when he was younger. He then puts it away for a bit but keeps coming back to it. We have a substantial Lego collection for him to pull from to supplement some of the tasks, so that helps. But as an almost ten-year-old he is still enjoying this.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: 8 Year old Grandson has fun with this.
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson enjoys the parts. Once he made a few builds using the instructions, he now creates his own things. Unfortunately, he has strong armed a couple of the parts while trying to assemble-disassemble things on his own and has broken a couple of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: ZeeKid

customer_reviews.title: Need additional Legos to complete these:(
customer_reviews.text: This arrived very quickly and I was really excited to purchase this for my son. But... a bit bummed to realize that I need to have specific additional lego pieces to create most of these chain reactions. That said a bit overpriced considering I need to make an additional purchase. There is a another book Lego book by Klutz that contains all pieces to make all the gadgets and that was much better. I may try to look for other ones similar to that.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalia Lucchese

customer_reviews.title: You can only build one because of the specialty pieces needed.
customer_reviews.text: Plan on building one project then tearing it apart to build another and so on. I have a massive amount of Legos but not the specialty ones needed to build more than one project at a time. It is misleading to see the pictures of all 10 projects lined up interacting with each other. Eventually I had to order lots of the specialty pieces to have all the projects together. They did come out cool.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly P.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's a Christmas present so it hasn't been used yet, but it looks great! It has some sturdy paper tear outs to use along with some of the gadgets plus some Lego pieces that you probably don't have to add to the things you can make. I think my nephew is going to love it and I can't wait for my son to be old enough to get him one, too!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Mann

customer_reviews.title: Seems Superfluous
customer_reviews.text: You buy this book and get a little baggy of LEGOs. Seems like you could just buy a cool LEGO kit and your kid would be happier. Mine would have preferred an actual kit. And honestly, so would I. Not the best LEGO purchase out there. Not the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for a very inquisitive and intelligent 8-year-old boy for his birthday. His mother is a professor of Chemistry, and she advised me that both she and her son get alot of use out of this product! It is also great for his younger sister for learning about science and building things.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Kept the kids entertained
customer_reviews.text: My kids love. Love. Love this LEGO kit. They have been playing with it non stop. The only one drawback would be the string it comes with. I would use it conservatively. This kit was very affordable and help the kids entertained for several days.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great IF you have a lot of blocks
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a kit for new Lego builders as it does NOT come with everything you need to build the contraptions! For use it was perfect as our Lego builders (9 and 5) have more than enough bricks to do each of these builds without even having to pull them apart. Give new life to old bricks!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: so when I saw this I knew it would be perfect for him
customer_reviews.text: My son is 9 and a Lego fanatic, so when I saw this I knew it would be perfect for him. He has already made so many of the creations inside, I am blown away by the challenging concepts that are in these designs! Even though it challenges him, it is well within his abilities to follow the directions provided. I like that all of the items necessary are provided in the kit, and that it comes with a storage compartment for the small pieces. My son loves this product and I do too! I cannot think of one thing that I would consider to be a negative thing or any sort of a con to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kellogg Family

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my 4yo lego enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: My 4 yo and I just built the first project together. He is a real lego enthusiast and usually does sets for ages 6-8+ by himself. He really enjoyed the first project and learning about chain reactions and learning how to measure using the included ruler. He can't wait to do the other projects. The instructions were very clear and easy to follow for him, he just needed help on a few things such as tying a knot in the string.
customer_reviews.author: rj

customer_reviews.title: Nah, not great.
customer_reviews.text: There aren’t many LEGO pieces. After 5min my 10 year old son was bored. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, not so great execution
customer_reviews.text: In concept, this is AMAZING! But unless your child (young or old) is very detailed, has an abundance of legos already, and incredible patience... it becomes just another book lying around and extra random pieces that you step on and fall over. I’m sure for some, this is an awesome addition to their “educational entertainment” section but for us, it’s just become a tripping hazard.
customer_reviews.author: xoxoxo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2nd grade and up.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter jumped right into this during quarantine 2020. It has all the great STEM education kids need- but it looks like a TOY! I’m seriously impressed and buying a bunch for birthday gifts, if we are ever released from quarantine...
customer_reviews.author: K. Klett

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loved It
customer_reviews.text: My grandson just turned 12 and I gave this to him for his birthday. It was a big hit. He made two of the projects immediately. Luckily he had a lot of leggos, so he had the pieces needed to complete the projects. When I bought the product I was not aware that you had to have some of your own leggos to complete the projects.
customer_reviews.author: Lighthouse Rita

customer_reviews.title: My 8yo son loved it
customer_reviews.text: My son is a Lego enthusiast so he asked me to get him this set. The instructions are clear and he built a lot of cool chain reactions. Some of the items are cardstock material so eventually they'll wear out
customer_reviews.author: AlexiG

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an answer to I'm Bored my kids love!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome addition to the regular legos. Many people have asked if it is good for older kids and I can say without a doubt my 13 year old son loves this. It is an awesome answer to the "i'm bored" blues! My 10 year old girls love to play with this too!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2WAM

customer_reviews.title: Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 9yo grandson. He absolutely loved it and it was the first gift he played with. I also git one for my 7yo grandson as a project his dad could work on with him. I would recommend this for sure.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition For Your Lego Fan!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for an almost 7 year old avid builder. He loves to create and follows written directions well. He has had a blast with the Klutz LEGO Chain Reactions Craft Kit. While the others continued opening their Christmas gifts. He stopped and began building with this one! It has been used in many different ways during the last few months. It has been much enjoyed and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Not being too easy to assemble is a plus in my opinion. My grandson was very happy with this set. There are unusual parts we’ve never come across before which is also a plus. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: barbANDjess

customer_reviews.title: The book has great building ideas
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12-year old grandson's birthday. He is a long-time Lego buff who has more Lego sets than there are fleas on a dog. He was thrilled with this gift. There are very few Lego pieces included, but they are unique and don't come with other sets. The book has great building ideas. This is a wonderful addition to anyone's already existing extensive Lego supply.
customer_reviews.author: Anaboena

customer_reviews.title: Paper parts, very less lego pieces, most of the package weight is the instruction book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 year old son. He is not happy with the toy. He stopped playing with it within 2 days of purchase. No idea how this got high reviews on Amazon. Most of the weight of the package is the instruction book. There are surprisingly few number of bundled lego pieces (the actual toy). My son also mentioned that he needs extra lego pieces to do many of the puzzles in the book. The puzzles include couple of ramps, which are fragile foldable paper pieces included with book. If you bend them, you got to build your own with thick paper.
customer_reviews.author: Chanaveer

customer_reviews.title: ESP at work!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson just opened this gift this morning and screamed with delight. My daughter tried to buy it for him, but it wasn't available (perhaps because I got the last one?). I didn't even know he knew about this, and now feel like a genius grandmother!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lis

customer_reviews.title: Great for young kids but not so much for older.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I chose 4 stars is because it’s way too simple for my 13 year old which is on me. I bought it as a small extra Christmas gift thinking it would be a time filler when she needs something creative to do but it’s just way too easy. So, it’s a great product just definitely for much younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Must have more legos at home.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a really great gift IF the recipient already has legos. The cover states it has over 30 ESSENTIAL pieces. But apparently it didn't have all the pieces necessary to built more than one contraption. I got this for my 9 year old while he spends the summer with his grandparents. He has a ton of legos at home, but didn't bring them, so now he can't finish the builds.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Expected more of this set. I didn't mind that it only had a few legos. But the paper pieces where you build the obstacles with, is made with such a thin paper. It's not much heavier than paper from an art pad you draw on. A lot of the pieces ripped when taking them out to assemble. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Olguin

customer_reviews.title: Read description carefully
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how I missed it but I assumed this was a box of legos. Did not think it was a book. Please read descriptions carefully. Also read the long reviews. Found them helpful for true lago fans.
customer_reviews.author: meleny luciano

customer_reviews.title: One of the best toys we ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best toys we ever owned. My son saved up for weeks to purchase this on his own and played with it every day. Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazin-Pete

customer_reviews.title: Major flaw
customer_reviews.text: this book requires pieces from your existing Lego stash. Should be fine, we have at least 30 different sets including Classics which include tons of pierces. The problem is that it frequently request 8X2 blocks, and that is not a typical Lego size. We have 2 of them, but several projects call for more. So now we are trying to find a set which includes 8X2. We found this to be a major, and frustrating, flaw with this book. Otherwise, my son loves it when we can modify.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Beckerley

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Fun
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun projects for any LEGO-lover! Took our LEGO building to a whole different level of fun. My 9 year old spent a good amount of time figuring out some fun projects to build.
customer_reviews.author: Stacia313

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on prime day as gift for my son. Had I not gotten a deal on this I don't think I would have paid full cost. The book is flimsy and the pages seem easy to tear. My son will love building the projects but we will have to take extra precaution in not damaging the book as it's not durable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Interesting concept but way overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I could have purchased the handful of legos from a second hand store. The projects they lay out in the book are sort of interesting.
customer_reviews.author: SingleDad

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous gift for a little Lego obsessive
customer_reviews.text: We're on day two of coronavirus homeschool and busted this out. Our Lego wiz almost 5yo didn't want to do anything else all day. Older kids will surely enjoy on their own; our guy needed a little help with tying knots and other delicate bits. A terrific value. I'll be giving this as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowroses

customer_reviews.title: It's alright, but it's hard to build several of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's alright, but it's hard to build several of the projects to chain together, if you don't have a decent collection of legos already. The balls are light, and the Rube Goldberg-esque chain reactions don't always go off right. (We see a 50/50 chance.)
customer_reviews.author: charcoal

customer_reviews.title: Great for LEGO lovers.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason for 4 stars is that I am still hunting down some of the special parts. You only have the name size and color, but sometimes that was not enough. Too bad part number is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Sue

product_meta.title: Klutz Lego Chain Reactions Science & Building Kit, Age 8, Multicolor
product_meta.description:
LEGO Chain Reactions is packed full of ideas, instructions, and inspiration for 10 LEGO machines that spin, swing, pivot, roll, lift, and drop. Each machine alone is awesome, but put them together and you get incredible chain reactions. Then, combine the machines in any order you like to create your own chain reactions. Our team of experts worked with educators and 11-year-olds to invent the machines, then wrote a book that teaches the skills (and some of the physics behind the fun) kids need to create their own amazing chain reaction machines.

Our book includes 33 special LEGO elements that combine with basic bricks from your collection to make your machines go. But don’t worry that you won’t have the right bricks; we worked with the folks at LEGO to make sure you’ll need only the most common bricks, and that there are plenty of substitutes. The result is a chain reaction of fun, as one thing leads to another… and another… and another.

Comes with: 78 page book, 33 LEGO elements, 6 LEGO balls, 6 feet of string, 8 paper ramps, 2 paper pop-up signs, 1 paper funnel ramp, 1 paper flag, 1 paper bucket, 1 platform

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Fascinate your friends by completing an ordinary task in an extraordinary way. Learn to build 10 LEGO machines that can swing, pivot, roll, lift, and drop. Then connect, rearrange, and experiment with the machines to create a chain reaction. With this book in hand and a handful of basic bricks from your LEGO collection, the only other thing you'll need is a little imagination. Includes 80-page book of instructions, 33 LEGO pieces, instructions for 10 machines, 6 plastic balls, string, paper ramps, and other components.
feature_bullets: Design and build 10 amazing moving machines - teach your bricks new tricks
Comes with 80 page instructions, 33 LEGO pieces, Instructions for 10 modules, 6 plastic balls, string, paper ramps and other components
Includes a 80 page instructional book with Klutz Certified crystal clear instructions
Includes more than 30 essential LEGO elements
